Name: A1
Directions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, mix and serve over ice into a chilled glass.

Name: ABC
Directions: Layered in a shot glass.

Name: Ace
Directions: Shake all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker and ice then strain in a cold glass.

Name: Adam
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Name: AT&T
Directions: Pour Vodka and Gin over ice, add Tonic and Stir

Name: ACID
Directions: Poor in the 151 first followed by the 101 served with a Coke or Dr Pepper chaser.

Name: A. J.
Directions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Affair
Directions: Pour schnapps, orange juice, and cranberry juice over ice in a highball glass. Top with club soda and serve.

Name: Apello
Directions: Stirr. Grnish with maraschino cherry.

Name: Avalon
Directions: Fill a tall glass with ice. Layer the Finlandia Vodka, lemon and apple juices, Pisang Ambon, and top up with lemonade. Stir slightly and garnish with a spiralled cucumber skin and a red cherry. The cucumber provides zest and looks attractive. This drink, created by Timo Haimi, took first prize in the 1991 Finlandia Vodka Long Drink Competition.

Name: Abilene
Directions: Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

Name: Almeria
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Name: Addison
Directions: Shake together all the ingredients and strain into a cold glass.

Name: Acapulco
Directions: Combine and shake all ingredients (except mint) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the sprig of mint and serve.

Name: Affinity
Directions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Name: Applecar
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Aviation
Directions: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.

Name: Alexander
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

Name: Algonquin
Directions: Combine and shake all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Allegheny
Directions: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the twist of lemon peel and serve.

Name: Artillery
Directions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Afterglow
Directions: Mix. Serve over ice.

Name: Autodaf√©
Directions: Mix and fill up with soda water. Drunk by finns on a sunny day any time of the year and day.

Name: Afternoon
Directions: Build into a suiting glass, with no ice. Cream on top if wanted. Served directly.

Name: After sex
Directions: Pour the vodka and creme over some ice cubes in a tall glass and fill up with juice. to make it beuty full make the top of the glass with a grenadine and sugar

Name: B-53
Directions: Layer the Kahlua, Sambucca and Grand Marnier into a shot glas in that order. Better than B-52

Name: B-52
Directions: Layer ingredients into a shot glass. Serve with a stirrer.

Name: Bijou
Directions: Stir in mixing glass with ice and strain

Name: Boxcar
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.

Name: Big Red
Directions: Pour ingredients into 1 ounce shot glass

Name: Bellini
Directions: Pour peach pur√©e into chilled flute, add sparkling wine. Stir gently.

Name: Bramble
Directions: Fill glass with crushed ice. Build gin, lemon juice and simple syrup over. Stir, and then pour blackberry liqueur over in a circular fashion to create marbling effect. Garnish with two blackberries and lemon slice.

Name: Balmoral
Directions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Name: Bluebird
Directions: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine the gin, triple sec, Curacao, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist and the cherry.

Name: Brooklyn
Directions: Combine ingredients with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Name: Boomerang
Directions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, vermouth, bitters, and maraschino liqueur. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry.

Name: Bora Bora
Directions: Prepare in a blender or shaker, serve in a highball glass on the rocks. Garnish with 1 slice of pineapple and one cherry.

Name: Barracuda
Directions: Shake pour ingredients with ice. Strain into glass, top with Sparkling wine.

Name: Buccaneer
Directions: Pour the corona into an 18oz beer glass pour the bacardi limon into the beer stir very gently

Name: Brigadier
Directions: Mix ingredients in a warmed mug and stir.

Name: Broadside
Directions: Half fill the glass with ice cubes. Crush the wormwood and add to ice. Pour rum, scotch and butters, then serve!

Name: Blackthorn
Directions: Stir sloe gin and vermouth with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

Name: Bob Marley
Directions: Layer in a 2 oz shot glass or pony glass

Name: Bubble Gum
Directions: Layer in order into a shot glass.

Name: Bible Belt
Directions: Mix all ingredients, and pour over ice.

Name: Brain Fart
Directions: Mix all ingredients together. Slowly and gently. Works best if ice is added to punch bowl and soda's are very cold.

Name: Bloody Mary
Directions: Stirring gently, pour all ingredients into highball glass. Garnish.

Name: Blue Lagoon
Directions: Pour vodka and curacao over ice in a highball glass. Fill with lemonade, top with the cherry, and serve.

Name: Boston Sour
Directions: Shake juice of lemon, powdered sugar, blended whiskey, and egg white with cracked ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

Name: Brandy Flip
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the brandy, egg, sugar, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the nutmeg.

Name: Casino
Directions: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist and a maraschino cherry. Serve without a straw.

Name: Caipirinha
Directions: Place lime and sugar into old fashioned glass and muddle (mash the two ingredients together using a muddler or a wooden spoon). Fill the glass with ice and add the Cacha√ßa.

Name: Cherry Rum
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Cuba Libre
Directions: Build all ingredients in a Collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

Name: Cuba Libra
Directions: Fill tall glass with ice cubes. Add rum. Rub cut edge of lime on rim of glass then squeeze juice into glass. Fill with Coca-Cola. Garnish with lime slice. Enjoy!

Name: Cafe Savoy
Directions: Fill mug almost to top with coffee.Add milk, triple sec and brandy. Stir.

Name: Cream Soda
Directions: Pour 1oz of Spiced Rum into a highball glass with ice. Fill with Ginger Ale.

Name: Corn n Oil
Directions: Cut the half lime in half again. Add the lime, falernum, and bitters to a rocks glass. Muddle. Add the rum. (Aged Barbados rum such as Plantation 5 Year is recommended). Add ice and stir. Float the blackstrap rum on top. Serve with a straw.

Name: Casa Blanca
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Clover Club
Directions: Dry shake ingredients to emulsify, add ice, shake and served straight up.

Name: Citrus Coke
Directions: Pour half of coke in a glass. Then add Bacardi and top it off with the remaining coke. Stir and drink up!

Name: Chicago Fizz
Directions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

Name: City Slicker
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Name: Coffee-Vodka
Directions: Boil water and sugar until dissolved. Turn off heat. Slowly add dry instant coffee and continue stirring. Add a chopped vanilla bean to the vodka, then combine the cooled sugar syrup and coffee solution with the vodka. Cover tightly and shake vigorously each day for 3 weeks. Strain and filter. Its also best to let the sugar mixture cool completely so the vodka won't evaporate when its added. If you like a smoother feel to the liqueur you can add about 1 teaspoon of glycerine to the finished product.

Name: Caipirissima
Directions: Same as Caipirinha but instead of cachaca you add WHITE RUM. It's great!!!!!!!!

Name: Campari Beer
Directions: Use a 15 oz glass. Add Campari first. Fill with beer.

Name: Cosmopolitan
Directions: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and double strain into large cocktail glass. Garnish with lime wheel.

Name: Casino Royale
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.

Name: Clove Cocktail
Directions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Coffee Liqueur
Directions: Combine coffee, sugar and water. Simmer 1 hour and let cool. Add vanilla and vodka. Age in sealed jar 2 to 3 weeks.

Name: Chocolate Milk
Directions: Put the milk in the bottom, pour the Liquer on top and add the dash of amaretto. Do not mix. SLAM IT!

Name: Coke and Drops
Directions: Take a glass, pour the Coke in the glass, then you take 7 drops of lemon juice. Granish with a lemon slice on the rim of the glass.

Name: Chocolate Drink
Directions: Melt the bar in a small amount of boiling water. Add milk. Cook over low heat, whipping gently (with a whisk, i would assume) until heated well. Don't let it boil! Serve in coffee mug.

Name: Creme de Menthe
Directions: Bring sugar and water to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Cool. Add the remaining ingredients and stir. Cover and let ripen for 1 month.

Name: Cranberry Punch
Directions: Combine first four ingredients. Stir until sugar is dissolved, chill. Then add ginger ale just before serving. Add ice ring to keep punch cold.

Name: Derby
Directions: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice. Stir. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint in the drink.

Name: Diesel
Directions: Pour the lager first then add the blackcurrant cordial. Top up with the cider. The colour sholud be very dark approaching the colour of Guiness.

Name: Daiquiri
Directions: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail glass.

Name: Danbooka
Directions: pour it in and mix it.

Name: Dragonfly
Directions: In a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and ginger ale. Stir well. Garnish with the lime wedge.

Name: Downshift
Directions: Start with the Sprite. Next comes the tequila. After that, add the Minute Maid Fruit Punch, then float the 151. Rocks optional.

Name: Dry Rob Roy
Directions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

Name: Dry Martini
Directions: Straight: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain in chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.

Name: Dirty Nipple
Directions: This is a layered shot - the Bailey's must be on top

Name: Dirty Martini
Directions:
Pour the vodka, dry vermouth and olive brine into a cocktail shaker with a handful of ice and shake well.
Rub the rim of a martini glass with the wedge of lemon.
Strain the contents of the cocktail shaker into the glass and add the olive.
A dirty Martini contains a splash of olive brine or olive juice and is typically garnished with an olive.

Name: Darkwood Sling
Directions: There are many good cherry liqueurs you can use, but I prefere Heering. Add one share of the liqueur. Then you add one share of Soda. For a sour sling use Tonic (most people prefer the drink without Tonic). Afterwards you fill the glass with Orange Juice and ice cubes.

Name: Dark Caipirinha
Directions:
Muddle the sugar into the lime wedges in an old-fashioned glass.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Pour the cachaca into the glass.
Stir well.

Name: Duchamp's Punch
Directions:
Shake all ingredients.
Double strain in a chilled double old fashioned glass with abig ice cube.
Garnish with a couple of lavender sprigs

Name: Dark and Stormy
Directions: In a highball glass filled with ice add 6cl dark rum and top with ginger beer. Garnish with lime wedge.

Name: Damned if you do
Directions: Pour into shot glass. Put in mouth. Repeat as deemed necessary.

Name: Dubonnet Cocktail
Directions: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

Name: Drinking Chocolate
Directions: Heat the cream and milk with the cinnamon and vanilla bean very slowly for 15-20 minutes. (If you don't have any beans add 1-2 tsp of vanilla after heating). Remove the bean and cinnamon. Add the chocolate. Mix until fully melted. Serve topped with some very dense fresh whipped cream. Serves 1-2 depending upon how much of a glutton you are. For a richer chocolate, use 4 oz of milk, 4 oz of cream, 4 oz of chocolate. Serve in coffee mug.

Name: Egg Cream
Directions: Mix syrup and milk in a fountain glass. Add soda water, serve with a straw.

Name: Egg Nog #4
Directions: In a small mixer bowl beat egg yolks till blended. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, beating at high speed till thick and lemon colored. Stir in milk, stir in rum, bourbon, vanilla, and salt. Chill thoroughly. Whip cream. Wash beaters well. In a large mixer bowl beat egg whites till soft peaks form. Gradually add remaining 1/4 cup sugar, beating to stiff peaks. Fold yolk mixture and whipped cream into egg whites. Serve immediately. Sprinkle nutmeg over each serving. Serve in a punch bowl or another big bowl. NOTE: For a nonalcoholic eggnog, prepare Eggnog as above, except omit the bourbon and rum and increase the milk to 3 cups.

Name: English Highball
Directions: Pour brandy, gin, and sweet vermouth into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water. Add the twist of lemon peel, stir, and serve. (Ginger ale may be substituted for carbonated water, if preferred.)

Name: Espresso Martini
Directions: Pour ingredients into shaker filled with ice, shake vigorously, and strain into chilled martini glass

Name: Espresso Rumtini
Directions: Mix together in a cocktail glass. Garnish with some choclate powder and coffee beans

Name: Egg Nog - Healthy
Directions: Whip egg substitute and sugar together, combine with the two kinds of milk, vanilla, and rum. Mix well. Chill over night. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Makes 6 servings.

Name: English Rose Cocktail
Directions: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lemon juice and dip rim of glass in powdered sugar. Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into sugar-rimmed glass. Top with the cherry and serve.

Name: Egg-Nog - Classic Cooked
Directions: In large saucepan, beat together eggs, sugar and salt, if desired. Stir in 2 cups of the milk. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick enough to coat a metal spoon and reaches 160 degrees F. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 2 cups milk and vanilla. Cover and regfigerate until thoroughly chilled, several hours or overnight. Just before serving, pour into bowl or pitcher. Garnish or add stir-ins, if desired. Choose 1 or several of: Chocolate curls, cinnamon sticks, extracts of flavorings, flavored brandy or liqueur, fruit juice or nectar, ground nutmeg, maraschino cherries, orange slices, peppermint sticks or candy canes, plain brandy, run or whiskey, sherbet or ice-cream, whipping cream, whipped. Serve immediately.

Name: Empell√≥n Cocina's Fat-Washed Mezcal
Directions:
To ensure that your pork fat is just as delicious as theirs, here‚Äôs their adobo marinade and what to do with it (you‚Äôll also need a rack of ribs):

4 ancho chiles, 8 guajillo chiles and 4 chipotle chiles, plus 4 cloves roasted garlic, half a cup of cider vinegar, a quarter teaspoon of Mexican oregano, 1 teaspoon of ground black pepper, a whole clove, a quarter teaspoon of ground cinnamon and a half teaspoon of ground cumin.

Toast the dried chiles and soak in water for at least an hour until they are rehydrated. Drain and discard the soaking liquid. Combine the soaked chiles with the remaining ingredients and pur√©e until smooth.

Cold smoke a rack of baby back pork ribs by taking a large hotel pan with woodchips on one side and charcoal on the other. Place another, smaller, pan with pork ribs, above the charcoal/woodchip pan. Ignite the charcoal, being careful to not ignite the woodchips. Cover both pans with foil and allow to smoke for 10-15 minutes, until desired level of smoke is achieved, then coat with adobo marinade and wrap in tin foil prior to placing ribs in a 300 degree oven for 7 hours. When the ribs have cooled, strain off the fat and use for the infusion.

If you‚Äôre having a hard time coming up to the same kind of volume of fat, make up the balance with pork lard from a butcher. To get the same depth of flavor without the ribs, heat up the fat in a pot with a few spoons of the marinade.

Once you‚Äôve got your tub of seasoned pork fat in cooled liquid form, pour equal amounts of Ilegal Joven mezcal and fat into a sealable container. Seal the container and give it a really good shake, then put it in the freezer overnight. When the whole thing is separated and congealed, pour it through a fine mesh chinoise. If you don‚Äôt have a chinoise, try a fine mesh strainer, or if you don‚Äôt have one of those, try spooning off most of the fat. There will be some beads of orange fat left in the strained mezcal: run that through a few layers of cheesecloth (or coffee filters in a pinch) to get rid of the last of it.

The mezcal is now ready for drinking, straight-up or in a cocktail. 

Habanero tincture

Slice habaneros and add 2 ounces Ilegal Joven mezcal.
Allow to sit overnight or until desired level of heat is achieved.
Cocktail

Combine mezcal and chocolate liqueur in a mixing glass with ice and stir for 45 seconds.
Strain into chilled coupe.
Carefully "sink" the coffee liqueur down the inside of the coupe over a spoon.
Garnish with 5 drops habanero tincture.

Name: Frapp√©
Directions: Mix together. Blend at highest blender speed for about 1 minute. Pour into a glass and drink with a straw. Notes: This works best if everything is cold (if you make fresh coffee, mix it with the milk and let it sit in the fridge for 1/2 hour. If it is not frothy, add more milk, or even just some more milk powder. The froth gradually turns to liquid at the bottom of the glass, so you will find that you can sit and drink this for about 1/2 hour, with more iced coffee continually appearing at the bottom. Very refreshing.

Name: Foxy Lady
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: French 75
Directions: Combine gin, sugar, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled champagne glass. Top up with Champagne. Stir gently.

Name: French "75"
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, sugar, and lemon juice. Shake well. Pour into a collins glass. Top with the Champagne. Stir well and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.

Name: Frisco Sour
Directions: Shake all ingredients (except slices of lemon and lime) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with the slices of lemon and lime and serve.

Name: Fruit Shake
Directions: Blend til smooth.

Name: Fruit Cooler
Directions: Toss strawberries with sugar, and let sit overnight in refrigerator. Cut lemon, reserve two slices. Juice the rest. Mix together the lemon juice, strawberries, apple juice, and soda water. Add slices of lemon (decor, really). In glasses, put ice cubes, and a slice of apple. Pour drink in, and serve.

Name: Freddy Kruger
Directions: make it an ample size shot!!

Name: Fuzzy Asshole
Directions: fill coffe mug half full of coffee. Fill the other half full of Peach Schnapps. Stir and drink while hot.

Name: French Martini
Directions: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink.

Name: French Negroni
Directions:
Add ice to a shaker and pour in all ingredients.
Using a bar spoon, stir 40 to 45 revolutions or until thoroughly chilled.
Strain into a martini glass or over ice into a rocks glass. Garnish with orange twist.

Name: Flying Dutchman
Directions: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and triple sec. Stir well.

Name: Frozen Daiquiri
Directions: Combine all ingredients (except for the cherry) in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for five seconds, then blend at a high speed until firm. Pour contents into a champagne flute, top with the cherry, and serve.

Name: Fruit Flip-Flop
Directions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

Name: Fahrenheit 5000
Directions: Cover bottom of shot glass with Tabasco Sauce and then fill with half Firewater and half Absolut Peppar.

Name: Flying Scotchman
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: French Connection
Directions: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

Name: Flaming Dr. Pepper
Directions: Add Amaretto, Bacardi, and vodka. Mix in the Dr. Pepper and beer

Name: Flander's Flake-Out
Directions: Bang 'em both in.

Name: Flaming Lamborghini
Directions: Pour the Sambuca and Kahlua into the Cocktail Glass and give the drinker a straw. Pour the Baileys and Blue Curacao into two sepsrate shot glasses either side of the cocktail glass. Set light the concotion in the cocktail glass and start to drink through the straw (this drink should be drunk in one) , as the bottom of the glass is reached put out the fire by pouring the Baileys and Blue Curacao into the cocktail glass and keep drinking till it's all gone!!

Name: Frozen Mint Daiquiri
Directions: Combine all ingredients with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and serve.

Name: Frozen Pineapple Daiquiri
Directions: Combine all ingredients with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a champagne flute and serve.

Name: GG
Directions: Pour the Galliano liqueur over ice. Fill the remainder of the glass with ginger ale and thats all there is to it. You now have a your very own GG.

Name: Gimlet
Directions:
Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.

Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass or an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.

Garnish with a lime wheel.

Name: Gin Fizz
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice cubes, except soda water. Pour into glass. Top with soda water.

Name: Gin Sour
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.

Name: Godchild
Directions: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a champagne flute, and serve.

Name: Gin Daisy
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the wine, lemon juice, sugar, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.

Name: Gin Sling
Directions: Dissolve powdered sugar in mixture of water and juice of lemon. Add gin. Pour into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes and stir. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.

Name: Gin Smash
Directions: Muddle sugar with carbonated water and mint sprigs in an old-fashioned glass. Add gin and 1 ice cube. Stir, add the orange slice and the cherry, and serve.

Name: Gin Toddy
Directions: Mix powdered sugar and water in an old-fashioned glass. Add gin and one ice cube. Stir, add the twist of lemon peel, and serve.

Name: Godfather
Directions: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

Name: Godmother
Directions: Pour vodka and amaretto into an old-fashioned glass over ice and serve.

Name: Gagliardo
Directions: Shake well and serve in a cocktail glass. This is a home cocktail of American/Internet Bar del Pozzo, Pavia, Italy.

Name: Gluehwein
Directions: Boil sugar and spices in water, leave in the water for 30 minutes. Strain the spiced water and mix with the wine. Heat slowly until short of boiling temperature. (To remove alcohol, let it boil for a while.) You may add lemon or orange juice to taste. Serve in irish coffee cup.

Name: Greyhound
Directions:
Add the vodka to a Collins glass filled with ice.
Top with grapefruit juice and stir.

Name: Gin Cooler
Directions: Stir powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice and add gin. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the lemon peel and the orange spiral so that the end of the orange spiral dangles over rim of glass.

Name: Gin Squirt
Directions: Stir gin, grenadine, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Decorate with the pineapple chunks and the strawberries and serve.

Name: Grand Blue
Directions: Serve in an old fashioned glass.

Name: Gin Rickey
Directions: Half-fill a tall glass with ice. Mix the gin and Grenadine together and pour over the ice. Add the lime or lemon juice and top off with soda water. Decorate the glass with lime and/or lemon slices.

Name: Gin Swizzle
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the lime juice, sugar, gin, and bitters. Shake well. Almost fill a colling glass with ice cubes. Stir until the glass is frosted. Strain the mixture in the shaker into the glass and add the club soda.

Name: Grass Skirt
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, triple sec, pineapple juice, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the pineapple slice.

Name: Grim Reaper
Directions: Mix Kahlua and 151 in glass. Quickly add ice and pour grenadine over ice to give ice red tint.

Name: Grasshopper
Directions: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake briskly and then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Name: Grizzly Bear
Directions: Served over ice. Sounds nasty, but tastes great.

Name: Green Goblin
Directions: Cider First, Lager then Curacao

Name: Golden dream
Directions: Shake with cracked ice. Strain into glass and serve.

Name: H.D.
Directions: Mix the whisky and Baileys Cream in a beer-glass (at least 50 cl). Fill the rest of the glass with coffee.

Name: Honney Bee
Directions: Shake ingredients with crushed ice

Name: Herbal flame
Directions: Pour Hot Damn 100 in bottom of a jar or regular glass. Fill the rest of the glass with sweet tea. Stir with spoon, straw, or better yet a cinnamon stick and leave it in.

Name: Horse's Neck
Directions: Pour brandy and ginger ale directly into highball glass with ice cubes. Stir gently. Garnish with lemon zest. If desired, add dashes of Angostura Bitter.

Name: Happy Skipper
Directions: Pour Captain Morgan's Spiced Rum over ice, fill glass to top with Ginger Ale. Garnish with lime. Tastes like a cream soda. Named for the Gilligan's Island reference ("The Captain" *in* "Ginger" is a Happy Skipper!)

Name: Hunter's Moon
Directions: Put the Bombay Sapphire, Martini Bianco, sugar syrup & blackberries in a cocktail shaker with lots of ice and shake vigorously before pouring into a balloon glass, topping up with lemonade and garnishing with a wedge of orange.

Name: Havana Cocktail
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Name: Holloween Punch
Directions: Take a bunch of grape juice and a bunch of fizzy stuff (club soda, ginger ale, lemonlime, whatever). Mix them in a punch bowl. Take orange sherbet and lime sherbet. Scoop out scoops and float them in the punch, let them melt a little so that a nasty film spreads all over the top of the punch but there are still "bubbles" in it in the form of sherbet scoops. Looks horrible, tastes just fine.

Name: Hot Creamy Bush
Directions: Combine all ingredients in glass

Name: Homemade Kahlua
Directions: Dissolve sugar in 2 cups of boiling water and add corn syrup. Dissolve the instant coffee in the remaining water. Pour syrup and coffee in a gallon jug. Let it cool. Add vodka and vanilla when cold. For the best result, let the mixture "mature" for 4-5 weeks.

Name: Halloween Punch
Directions:
Tip the cherry juice, orange peel, chilli, cinnamon sticks, cloves and ginger into a large saucepan. Simmer for 5 mins, then turn off the heat. Leave to cool, then chill for at least 4 hrs, or up to 2 days ‚Äì the longer you leave it the more intense the flavours. If serving to young children, take the chilli out after a few hours.

When you‚Äôre ready to serve, pour the juice into a jug. Serve in glass bottles or glasses and pop a straw in each. If you're adding vodka, do so at this stage. Dangle a fangs sweet from each glass.

Name: Harvey Wallbanger
Directions: Stir the vodka and orange juice with ice in the glass, then float the Galliano on top. Garnish and serve.

Name: Hawaiian Cocktail
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Hemingway Special
Directions: Pour all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake.

Name: Highland Fling Cocktail
Directions: Stir all ingredients (except olive) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the olive and serve.

Name: Hot Chocolate to Die for
Directions: Melt the chocolate, butter and vanilla in a double boiler. When just smooth stir in the cream.

Name: Ipamena
Directions: Cut half a lime into pieces, place in a shaker, add the sugar and crush. Measure the passion fruit juice, add it to the shaker and fill up with ice cubes. Close the shaker and shake vigorously. Pour the liquid into a glass, top up with ginger ale, stir with a teaspoon and then garnish the rim of the glass with a slice of lime

Name: Iced Coffee
Directions: Mix together until coffee and sugar is dissolved. Add milk. Shake well. Using a blender or milk shake maker produces a very foamy drink. Serve in coffee mug.

Name: Irish Cream
Directions: Mix scotch and milk. Add half-and-half. Add rest.

Name: Ice Pick #1
Directions: Put Vodka in glass fill with iced tea. Stir in lemon to taste.

Name: Irish Spring
Directions: Pour all ingredients (except orange slice and cherry) into a collins glass over ice cubes. Garnish with the slice of orange, add the cherry on top, and serve.

Name: Irish Coffee
Directions: Heat the coffee, whiskey and sugar; do not boil. Pour into glass and top with cream; serve hot.

Name: Imperial Fizz
Directions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

Name: Irish Russian
Directions: Add the ingredients in the order listed in the recipe. Care must be taken when adding the Guinness to prevent an excess of foam. Do Not add ice.

Name: Imperial Cocktail
Directions: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

Name: Iced Coffee Fillip
Directions: Mix together in a coffee mug and chill before serving.

Name: Irish Curdling Cow
Directions: Pour Irish Cream, Vodka, and Bourbon in a glass. Add some ice and mix in the orange juice.

Name: Jitterbug
Directions: Wet glass, dip rim in sugar. Then add Ice. Then add everything else. It's that simple!

Name: Jam Donut
Directions: Coat the rim of a shot glass with sugar using sugar syrup to stick. Add the Chambord raspberry liqueur to the shot glass, and carefully layer the Baileys Irish Cream on top. Serve.

Name: Jelly Bean
Directions: mix equal parts in pony glass-tastes just like a jelly bean!

Name: Jackhammer
Directions: Serve over ice- Warning,Deadly!

Name: Jello shots
Directions: Boil 3 cups of water then add jello. Mix jello and water until jello is completely disolved. Add the two cups of vodka and mix together. Pour mixture into plastic shot glasses and chill until firm. Then, eat away...

Name: John Collins
Directions: Pour all ingredients directly into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Garnish. Add a dash of Angostura bitters.

Name: Jamaica Kiss
Directions: Fill a tumbler with ice cubes. Add a shot of Tia Maria and a shot of Jamaican light rum. Fill the tumbler with milk. Blend until smooth and serve immediately.

Name: Japanese Fizz
Directions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

Name: Just a Moonmint
Directions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

Name: Jamaican Coffee
Directions: Stir the rum, coffee and water together. Top with the whipped cream. Sprinkle with a pinch of well ground coffee and drink with a straw.

Name: Jewel Of The Nile
Directions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Name: Jack Rose Cocktail
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Jack's Vanilla Coke
Directions: After pouring in your ingredients, and adding 3-5 ice cubes, according to taste. Stir the drink with a stirrer to get the Vanilla off the bottom.

Name: Kir
Directions: Add the cr√®me de cassis to the bottom of the glass, then top up with wine.

Name: Karsk
Directions: Put a copper coin in a coffe-cup and fill up with coffee until you no longer see the coin, then add alcohol until you see the coin. Norwegian speciality.

Name: Kamikaze
Directions: Shake all ingredients together with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve.

Name: Kir Royale
Directions: Pour Creme de cassis in glass, gently pour champagne on top

Name: Kurant Tea
Directions: Pour Absolut Kurant into a comfortably big tea-cup. Add the not too hot(!) apple tea and, if you like, some sugar. Enjoy!

Name: Kiwi Lemon
Directions: Mix in highball glass. Stirr. Garnish with slice of kiwi.

Name: Kioki Coffee
Directions: Stir. Add whipped cream to the top.

Name: Kool-Aid Shot
Directions: Pour into a large glass with ice and stir. Add a little cranberry juice to taste.

Name: Kiss me Quick
Directions: mix in the glass

Name: Kool First Aid
Directions: Add Kool Aid to a double shot glass, and top with rum. Slam and shoot.

Name: Kentucky B And B
Directions: Pour the bourbon and Benedictine into a brandy snifter.

Name: Kentucky Colonel
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes combine the courbon and Benedictine. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

Name: Kool-Aid Slammer
Directions: Fill half the shot glass with the kool-aid first. Then put a paper towel over the top of the glass and slowly pour in the vodka. If you do it right, you should be able to see that the two liquids are separated, with the vodka on top. Now slam it! The last thing you'll taste is the kool-aid.

Name: Kiwi Papaya Smoothie
Directions: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.

Name: Kill the cold Smoothie
Directions: Juice ginger and lemon and add it to hot water. You may add cardomom.

Name: Limeade
Directions: In a large glass, put the lime juice and sugar, and stir well. Add cold seltzer water to fill. Put the lime peels in the glass. Drink. Repeat until limes or soda run out.

Name: Lunch Box
Directions: Fill a pint glass almost full with beer. Then fill the rest with orange juice (careful not to fill it to the top). Then take the shot of Amaretto and drop it in.

Name: Lemon Shot
Directions: Mix Galliano and Absolut Citron in a shot glass, lay lemon wedge sprinkled with sugar over glass and pour a rum over wedge and glass. light rum with a lighter and let burn for a second. Do shot quickly and suck on lemon. If it is done correctly, this will taste like a shot of sweet lemonade.

Name: Long vodka
Directions: Shake a tall glass with ice cubes and Angostura, coating the inside of the glass. Por the vodka onto this, add 1 slice of lime and squeeze juice out of remainder, mix with tonic, stir and voila you have a Long Vodka

Name: Lemon Drop
Directions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass rimmed with sugar.

Name: Loch Lomond
Directions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, Drambuie, and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

Name: London Town
Directions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Name: Lassi Khara
Directions: Blend (frappe) in blender until frothy. Add torn curry leaves and serve cold.

Name: Lassi Raita
Directions: Blend the yoghurt and ice cubes together, until the yoghurt becomes more liquid. Add sugar to taste. The lemon/lime is optional but it gives it a slightly tart taste. Dash of salt. Raita is also good for the summer. Instead of having a traditional salad you can make raita instead.

Name: Lemouroudji
Directions: Juice the lemons. Peel and grate the ginger. Place the grated ginger and a liberal dash of the cayenne pepper into a piece of cheesecloth, and tie it into a knot. Let soak in the water. After 15 minutes or so, add the sugar, and the lemon juice. Chill, and serve.

Name: Lord And Lady
Directions: Pour the rum and Tia Maria into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

Name: Lassi - Sweet
Directions: Put all ingredients into a blender and blend until nice and frothy. Serve chilled.

Name: Lassi - Mango
Directions: Put it all in a blender and pour over crushed ice. You can also use other fruits like strawberries and bananas.

Name: Limona Corona
Directions: Open the Corona. Fill the empty space in the neck in the bottle with the rum. The bottle should be filled to the top. Plug the bottle with your thumb or the palm of your hand. Turn the bottle upside-down so the rum and beer mix. Turn the bottle rightside-up, unplug, and drink.

Name: Lady Love Fizz
Directions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

Name: Long Island Tea
Directions: Combine all ingredients (except cola) and pour over ice in a highball glass. Add the splash of cola for color. Decorate with a slice of lemon and serve.

Name: Lone Tree Cooler
Directions: Stir powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice, add gin and vermouth, and stir. Fill with carbonated water and stir again. Add the twist of lemon peel and the orange spiral so that the end dangles over rim of glass.

Name: Lone Tree Cocktail
Directions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Long Island Iced Tea
Directions: Mix all contents in a highball glass and sitr gently. Add dash of Coca-Cola for the coloring and garnish with lemon or lime twist.

Name: Lassi - A South Indian Drink
Directions: Blend in a blender for 3 seconds. Lassi is one of the easiest things to make, and there are many ways of making it. Basically, it is buttermilk (yoghurt whisked with water), and you can choose almost any consistency that you like, from the thinnest to the thickest. Serve cold.

Name: Melya
Directions: Brew espresso. In a coffee mug, place 1 teaspoon of unsweetened powdered cocoa, then cover a teaspoon with honey and drizzle it into the cup. Stir while the coffee brews, this is the fun part. The cocoa seems to coat the honey without mixing, so you get a dusty, sticky mass that looks as though it will never mix. Then all at once, presto! It looks like dark chocolate sauce. Pour hot espresso over the honey, stirring to dissolve. Serve with cream.

Name: Mojito
Directions: Muddle mint leaves with sugar and lime juice. Add a splash of soda water and fill the glass with cracked ice. Pour the rum and top with soda water. Garnish and serve with straw.

Name: Mimosa
Directions: Ensure both ingredients are well chilled, then mix into the glass. Serve cold.

Name: Mai Tai
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain into glass. Garnish and serve with straw.

Name: Martini
Directions: Straight: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain in chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.

Name: Margarita
Directions: Rub the rim of the glass with the lime slice to make the salt stick to it. Take care to moisten only the outer rim and sprinkle the salt on it. The salt should present to the lips of the imbiber and never mix into the cocktail. Shake the other ingredients with ice, then carefully pour into the glass.

Name: Manhattan
Directions: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served up.

Name: Mojito #3
Directions: Put mint with lemon juice in a glas, mash the mint with a spoon, ice, rum & fill up with club soda. Top it with Angostura.

Name: Miami Vice
Directions: First: Mix pina colada with 2.5 oz. of rum with ice(set aside). Second: Mix daiquiri with 2.5 oz. of rum with ice. Third: While frozen, add pina colda mix then daiquiri mix in glass (Making sure they do not get mixed together).

Name: Mudslinger
Directions: Add all contents to a large jug or punch bowl. Stir well!

Name: Moranguito
Directions: first you put rhe absinthe, then put tequila, then put the Granadine syrup.

Name: Mint Julep
Directions: In a highball glass gently muddle the mint, sugar and water. Fill the glass with cracked ice, add Bourbon and stir well until the glass is well frosted. Garnish with a mint sprig.

Name: Martinez 2
Directions:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.

Stir until chilled, and strain into a chilled coupe glass.

Name: Masala Chai
Directions: Bring 2 cups of water to boil. Add all the ingredients and boil again for about 15 seconds. Let stand for a minute. Warm milk in a pot. Filter tea into cups. Add milk and sugar. That's IT.

Name: Mulled Wine
Directions: Simmer 3 cups water with, sugar, cloves, cinnamon sticks, and lemon peel in a stainless steel pot for 10 minutes. Add wine heat to a "coffee temperature" (DO NOT BOIL) then add the brandy.

Name: Moscow Mule
Directions: Combine vodka and ginger beer in a highball glass filled with ice. Add lime juice. Stir gently. Garnish.

Name: Mocha-Berry
Directions: pour 6 oz. of coffee in a mug or Irish coffee cup. add coca mix and chambord, mix well and top off with whipped cream.

Name: Munich Mule
Directions:
Fill glass with ice
Pour Gin and Lime Juice
Fill glass with Ginger Beer
Garnish with Cucumer and Lime slice

Name: Monkey Gland
Directions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Name: Monkey Wrench
Directions: Pour all of the ingredients into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

Name: Midnight Manx
Directions: Fill a mixer with ice and add Baileys, Kahlua, Goldshlager, and cream. Shake for 5 seconds and Strain into a double rocks glass filled with ice. Add chilled coffee Stir and enjoy!

Name: Mother's Milk
Directions: Shake over ice, strain. Serves two.

Name: Midnight Mint
Directions: If available, rim cocktail (Martini) glass with sugar syrup then dip into chocolate flakes or powder. Add ingredients into shaker with ice. Shake well then strain into cocktail glass.

Name: Mary Pickford
Directions: Shake and strain into a chilled large cocktail glass

Name: Malibu Twister
Directions: Add rum & trister then, add cranberry jucie,stir

Name: Negroni
Directions: Stir into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

Name: New York Sour
Directions: Shake blended whiskey, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Float claret on top. Decorate with the half-slice of lemon and the cherry and serve.

Name: Nutty Irishman
Directions: Serve over ice

Name: National Aquarium
Directions: Pour all ingredients into a shaker of ice. Shake well. Serve on the rocks.

Name: New York Lemonade
Directions: Serve in a chilled cocktail glass. Lemon and sugar the rim. Stir and Strain.

Name: Nuked Hot Chocolate
Directions: Mix with a bit of milk (1 oz or so) in coffee mug. Nuke mug for about 30-50 seconds. Stir until the heated cocoa dissolves. Fill mug with milk. Nuke for 1-2 minutes, depending on wattage and preferences as to burnt mouth parts.

Name: Orgasm
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Old Pal
Directions: Chill cocktail glass. Add ingredients to a mixing glass, and fill 2/3 full with ice. Stir about 20 seconds. Empty cocktail glass and strain into the glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel.

Name: Orangeade
Directions: Place some ice cubes in a large tumbler or highball glass, add lemon juice, orange juice, sugar syrup, and stir well. Top up with cold soda water, serve with a drinking straw.

Name: Orange Whip
Directions: Pour ingredients over ice and stir.

Name: Orange Oasis
Directions: Shake brandy, gin, and orange juice with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.

Name: Orange Crush
Directions: Add all ingredients to tumbler-Pour as shot

Name: Old Fashioned
Directions:
Place sugar cube in old fashioned glass and saturate with bitters, add a dash of plain water. Muddle until dissolved.
Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whiskey.

Garnish with orange twist, and a cocktail cherry.

Name: Oreo Mudslide
Directions: Blend Vodka, Kahlua, Bailey's, ice-cream and the Oreo well in a blender. Pour into a large frosted glass. Garnish with whipped cream and a cherry.

Name: Orange Push-up
Directions: Combine liquors in a blender. Add a half scoop of ice and blend. Garnish with an orange and cherry flag. So good it will melt in your mouth!!!

Name: Oatmeal Cookie
Directions:
Just mix it all together.
It's meant to be a shot, but it works just fine as a proper adult-sized drink over lots of ice.

Tastes like an oatmeal cookie.

Name: Orange Scented Hot Chocolate
Directions: Combine all ingredients in heavy medium saucepan. Stir over low heat until chocolate melts. Increase heat and bring just to a boil, stirring often. Remove from heat and whisk untily frothy. Return to heat and bring to boil again. Remove from heat, whisk until frothy. Repeat heating and whisking once again. Discard orange peel. (Can be prepared 2 hours ahead. Let stand at room temperature. Before serving, bring just to boil, remove from heat and whisk until frothy.) Pour hot chocolate into coffee mugs. Makes 2 servings.

Name: Owen's Grandmother's Revenge
Directions: Add ingredients and mix in blender.

Name: Paloma
Directions: Stir together and serve over ice.

Name: Pink Gin
Directions: Pour the bitters into a wine glass. Swirl the glass to coat the inside with the bitters, shake out the excess. Pour the gin into the glass. Do not add ice.

Name: Paradise
Directions: Shake together over ice. Strain into cocktail glass and serve chilled.

Name: Pink Lady
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Pegu Club
Directions: Shake, strain, up, cocktail glass

Name: Pisco Sour
Directions: Vigorously shake and strain contents in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, then pour into glass and garnish with bitters.[1]

Name: Porto flip
Directions: Shake ingredients together in a mixer with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve.

Name: Penicillin
Directions: Shake blended Scotch, lemon juice, honey syrup and ginger syrup with ice. Strain over large ice in chilled rocks glass. Float smoky Scotch on top (be sure to use a smoky Scotch such as an Islay single malt). Garnish with candied ginger.

Name: Pina Colada
Directions: Mix with crushed ice in blender until smooth. Pour into chilled glass, garnish and serve.

Name: Pink Penocha
Directions: mix all ingredients into bowl keep iced stir frequently

Name: Popped cherry
Directions: Served over ice in a tall glass with a popped cherry (can add more popped cherries if in the mood)!

Name: Poppy Cocktail
Directions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Port Wine Flip
Directions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

Name: Planter's Punch
Directions: Pour all ingredients, except the bitters, into shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Pour into large glass, filled with ice. Add Angostura bitters, "on top". Garnish with cocktail cherry and pineapple.

Name: Port And Starboard
Directions: Pour carefully into a pousse-cafe glass, so that creme de menthe floats on grenadine. Serve without mixing.

Name: Port Wine Cocktail
Directions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Pysch Vitamin Light
Directions: Shake with ice.

Name: Pink Panty Pulldowns
Directions: Shake well

Name: Pineapple Gingerale Smoothie
Directions: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.

Name: Quentin
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, Kahlua, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the nutmeg.

Name: Queen Bee
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Quick F**K
Directions: In a shot glass add 1/3 Kahlua first. Then 1/3 Miduri, topping it off with a 1/3 bailey's irish cream

Name: Quick-sand
Directions: Simply add the orange juice, quite a quick pour in order to mix the sambucca with the orange juice. The juice MUST have fruit pulp!

Name: Queen Charlotte
Directions: Pour red wine and grenadine into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with lemon-lime soda, stir, and serve.

Name: Queen Elizabeth
Directions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Quaker's Cocktail
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Quarter Deck Cocktail
Directions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Rose
Directions: Shake together in a cocktail shaker, then strain into chilled glass. Garnish and serve.

Name: Radler
Directions: Pour beer into large mug, slowly add the 7-up (or Sprite).

Name: Rum Sour
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.

Name: Rum Toddy
Directions: Dissolve powdered sugar in water in an old-fashioned glass. Add rum and one ice cube and stir. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

Name: Rum Punch
Directions: Mix all ingredients in a punch bowl and serve.

Name: Royal Fizz
Directions: Shake all ingredients (except cola) with ice and strain into a chilled collins glass. Fill with cola and serve.

Name: Rum Cooler
Directions: Pour the rum and soda into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the lemon wedge.

Name: Rusty Nail
Directions: Pour the Scotch and Drambuie into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lemon twist.

Name: Rum Runner
Directions: Mix all ingredients in glass & add ice.

Name: Rum Cobbler
Directions: In an old-fashioned glass, dissolve the sugar in the club soda. Add crushed ice until the glass is almost full. Add the rum. Stir well. Garnish with the cherry and the orange and lemon slices.

Name: Red Snapper
Directions: One shot each, shake n shoot

Name: Royal Flush
Directions: Pour all the ingredients into tumbler over ice. Strain into glass.

Name: Royal Bitch
Directions: Into a shot glass layer the Crown Royal on top of the Frangelico.

Name: Ruby Tuesday
Directions: Pour gin and cranberry into a highball filled with ice cubes. Add grenadine and stir.

Name: Rail Splitter
Directions: Mix sugar syrup with lemon juice in a tall glass. Fill up with ginger ale.

Name: Rosemary Blue
Directions:
1) Add the Bombay Sapphire, Blue Curacao, rosemary sprig and gently squeezed lemon wedge to a balloon glass. Swirl well to combine.
2) Fill with cubed ice and top with the Fever-Tree Light Tonic Water.
3) Gently fold with a bar spoon to mix.

Name: Royal Gin Fizz
Directions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

Name: Rum Milk Punch
Directions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

Name: Rum Screwdriver
Directions: Pour rum into a highball glass over ice cubes. Add orange juice, stir, and serve.

Name: Raspberry Cooler
Directions: Pour the raspberry vodka and soda into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

Name: Rum Old-fashioned
Directions: Stir powdered sugar, water, and bitters in an old-fashioned glass. When sugar has dissolved add ice cubes and light rum. Add the twist of lime peel, float 151 proof rum on top, and serve.

Name: Russian Spring Punch
Directions: Pour the ingredients into an highball glass, top with Sparkling wine.

Name: Radioactive Long Island Iced Tea
Directions: Pour all ingredients over ice in a very tall glass. Sip cautiously.

Name: Smut
Directions: Throw it all together and serve real cold.

Name: Spritz
Directions: Build into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

Name: Sazerac
Directions: Rinse a chilled old-fashioned glass with the absinthe, add crushed ice, and set it aside. Stir the remaining ingredients over ice and set it aside. Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared glass, and strain the drink into the glass. Add the lemon peel for garnish.

Name: Scooter
Directions: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Sidecar
Directions: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass.

Name: Stinger
Directions: Pour in a mixing glass with ice, stir and strain into a cocktail glass. May also be served on rocks in a rocks glass.

Name: Snowball
Directions: Place one ice cube in the glass and add 1 1/2 oz of Advocaat. Fill up the glass with lemonade and decorate with a slice of lemon. Serve at once.

Name: Shot-gun
Directions: Pour one part Jack Daneils and one part Jim Beam into shot glass then float Wild Turkey on top.

Name: Spice 75
Directions:
Gently warm 60g golden caster sugar in a pan with 30ml water and 1 tbsp allspice. Cook gently until the sugar has dissolved, then leave the mixture to cool. Strain through a sieve lined with a coffee filter (or a double layer of kitchen paper).

Pour 60ml of the spiced syrup into a cocktail shaker along with 200ml rum and 90ml lime juice. Shake with ice and strain between six flute glasses. Top up with 600ml champagne and garnish each with an orange twist.

Name: Salty Dog
Directions: Pour all ingredients over ice cubes in a highball glass. Stir well and serve. (Vodka may be substituted for gin, if preferred.)

Name: Stone Sour
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled whiskey sour glass, and serve.

Name: Sangria #1
Directions: Mix all together in a pitcher and refrigerate. Add cloves and cinnamon sticks to taste. Serve in wine glasses.

Name: Sea breeze
Directions: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

Name: Scotch Sour
Directions: Shake scotch, juice of lime, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with 1/2 slice lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

Name: Screwdriver
Directions: Mix in a highball glass with ice. Garnish and serve.

Name: Sherry Flip
Directions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

Name: Sweet Tooth
Directions: Put 2 shots Godiva Liquour into a glass, add as much or as little milk as you would like.

Name: Sol Y Sombra
Directions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a brandy snifter, and serve. (The English translation of the name of this drink is "Sun and Shade", and after sampling this drink, you'll understand why. Thanks, Kirby.)

Name: Shark Attack
Directions: Mix lemonade and water according to instructions on back of can. If the instructions say to add 4 1/3 cans of water do so. Mix into pitcher. Add 1 1/2 cup of Vodka (Absolut). Mix well. Pour into glass of crushed ice. Excellent!

Name: Sherry Eggnog
Directions: Shake sherry, powdered sugar, and egg with ice and strain into a collins glass. Fill with milk and stir. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

Name: Sweet Bananas
Directions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

Name: Sweet Sangria
Directions: Dissolve the sugar in hot water and cool. Peel the citrus fruits and break into wedges. Mix the wine, sugar syrup, fruit, and Fresca in a pitcher and put in the fridge for a few hours. Serve in tall glasses with a straw.

Name: San Francisco
Directions: Take a tall glass and put in a few ice cubes, fill the vodka over it and fill with juice then the "creme", to end fill in the grenadine but very carefully at the side of the glass so it will lay down in the bottom. garnish with orange and strawberry.

Name: Space Odyssey
Directions: Fill glass with ice and add shots of Bacardi and Malibu. Add splash of pineapple juice and top with orange juice. Add grenadine for color and garnish with cherries.

Name: Scotch Cobbler
Directions: Pour scotch, brandy, and curacao over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Add the orange slice, top with the mint sprig, and serve.

Name: Thriller
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Name: Tia-Maria
Directions: Boil water, sugar and coffe for 10 mins and let cool. Add rum and vanilla. Put in clean bottle(s) and leave for 1 week before using.

Name: Tipperary
Directions: Stir over ice. Strain into chilled glass. Cut a wide swath of orange peel, and express the orange oils over the drink. Discard orange twist.

Name: Turkeyball
Directions: Shake with ice and strain into a shot glass.

Name: Tom Collins
Directions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass alomst filled with ice cubes. Add the club soda. Stir and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.

Name: Tomato Tang
Directions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

Name: Thai Coffee
Directions: Place the coffee and spices in the filter cone of your coffee maker. Brew coffee as usual, let it cool. In a tall glass, dissolve 1 or 2 teaspoons of sugar in an ounce of the coffee (it's easier to dissolve than if you put it right over ice). Add 5-6 ice cubes and pour coffee to within about 1 inch of the top of the glass. Rest a spoon on top of the coffee and slowly pour whipping cream into the spoon. This will make the cream float on top of the coffee rather than dispersing into it right away.

Name: Texas Sling
Directions: Blend with Ice until smooth. Serve in a tulip glass, top with whip cream.

Name: Tequila Fizz
Directions: Shake all ingredients (except ginger ale) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.

Name: Tequila Sour
Directions: Shake tequila, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the half-slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

Name: Talos Coffee
Directions: Add your GM and then add your coffee.

Name: Tennesee Mud
Directions: Mix Coffee, Jack Daniels and Amaretto. Add Cream on top.

Name: Turf Cocktail
Directions: Stir all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.

Name: Thai Iced Tea
Directions: Combine Thai tea (i.e., the powder), boiling water, and sweetened condensed milk, stir until blended. Pour into 2 tall glasses filled with ice cubes. Garnish with mint leaves. Makes 2 servings.

Name: The Last Word
Directions: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.

Name: The Laverstoke
Directions:
1) Squeeze two lime wedges into a balloon glass then add the cordial, Bombay Sapphire and MARTINI Rosso Vermouth, swirl to mix.

2) Fully fill the glass with cubed ice and stir to chill.

3) Top with Fever-Tree Ginger Ale and gently stir again to combine.

4) Garnish with a snapped ginger slice and an awoken mint sprig.

Name: Tuxedo Cocktail
Directions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry and a twist of lemon zest.

Name: Tequila Sunrise
Directions: Pour the tequila and orange juice into glass over ice. Add the grenadine, which will sink to the bottom. Stir gently to create the sunrise effect. Garnish and serve.

Name: Tequila Slammer
Directions: Mix carefully to avoid releasing the dissolved CO2.

Name: Thai Iced Coffee
Directions: Prepare a pot of coffee at a good European strength. In the ground coffee, add 2 or 3 freshly ground cardamom pods. Sweeten while hot, then cool quickly. Serve in highball glass over ice, with cream. To get the layered effect, place a spoon atop the coffee and pour the milk carefully into the spoon so that it floats on the top of the coffee.

Name: Tequila Surprise
Directions: Fill shot glass with Tequila. Add drops of Tobasco sauce.

Name: The Jimmy Conway
Directions:
Fill glass with ice
Pour in The Irishman and Disaronno
Fill to the top with Cranberry Juice
Garnish with a slice of lemon‚Ä¶Enjoy!

Name: Texas Rattlesnake
Directions: Mix all ingredients and Shake well. Sweet at first, with a BITE at the end...

Name: Tommy's Margarita
Directions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Name: The Evil Blue Thing
Directions: Pour ingredients into glass, and drop in a blue whale! The blue whale isn't really necessary, but it makes the drink more "fun".

Name: Victor
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Vesper
Directions: Shake over ice until well chilled, then strain into a deep goblet and garnish with a thin slice of lemon peel.

Name: Vesuvio
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

Name: Veteran
Directions: Pour the rum and cherry brandy into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

Name: Vampiro
Directions: Vampiros may be made in a tall glass or an old fashioned glass. Bartenders may first "rim" the glass with Kosher Salt, which is done by placing a layer of Kosher Salt on a chopping board, moistening the glass' rim with lime juice or water, and then placing the upside down glass rim onto the Kosher Salt, so that the salt sticks to the moistened rim. The second step is to fill half the glass with ice and add one or two shooter glasses full of high quality Tequila. The next stage is to add the flavouring elements. This is done by squeezing a fresh lime into the glass, adding a few grains of salt, adding citrus-flavoured soda pop, until the glass is 4/5 full, and then adding spicy Viuda de Sanchez (or orange juice, lime juice and pico de gallo). The final step is to stir the ingredients so that the flavours are properly blended.

Name: Van Vleet
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

Name: Vodka Fizz
Directions: Blend all ingredients, save nutmeg. Pour into large white wine glass and sprinkle nutmeg on top.

Name: Vodka Martini
Directions: Shake the vodka and vermouth together with a number of ice cubes, strain into a cocktail glass, add the olive and serve.

Name: Vodka Russian
Directions: Mix it as a ordinary drink .

Name: Vermouth Cassis
Directions: Stir vermouth and creme de cassis in a highball glass with ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir again, and serve.

Name: Victory Collins
Directions: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of orange and serve.

Name: Vodka And Tonic
Directions: Pour vodka into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with tonic water, stir, and serve.

Name: Valencia Cocktail
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Whisky Mac
Directions: Pour both of the ingredients into a wine goblet with no ice.

Name: Wine Punch
Directions: Combine all of the ingredients and pour over a block of ice.

Name: White Lady
Directions: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into large cocktail glass.

Name: Wine Cooler
Directions: Mix wine and soft drink. Pour into glass. Add ice.

Name: Whiskey Sour
Directions: Shake with ice. Strain into chilled glass, garnish and serve. If served 'On the rocks', strain ingredients into old-fashioned glass filled with ice.

Name: White Russian
Directions: Pour vodka and coffee liqueur over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass. Fill with light cream and serve.

Name: Whitecap Margarita
Directions: Place all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. This makes one drink.

Name: Waikiki Beachcomber
Directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Name: Yellow Bird
Directions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass

Name: Yoghurt Cooler
Directions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up. Note: Use lots of ice in this one - great on hot days! To add ice: Remove the center of the cover while the blender is on - drop 3 or 4 ice cubs and blend until they're completely crushed.

Name: Zorro
Directions: add all and pour black coffee and add whipped cream on top.

Name: Zinger
Directions: Get a shot glass and pour in three shots of the schnapps. Do the same with the Surge Cola. Then down it like Scheetz would.

Name: Zoksel
Directions: No specific mixinginstructions, just poor every ingredient in one glass. The lemon goes with it.

Name: Zombie
Directions:
Blend at high speed for no more than 5 seconds.

Pour into a glass, add ice cubes to fill, then add the garnish.

*Donn‚Äôs mix: Bring 3 crushed cinnamon sticks, 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of water to a boil, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.

Simmer for 2 minutes, then remove from the heat and let sit for at least 2 hours before straining into a clean glass bottle.

Then add 1 part of the syrup and 2 parts of fresh grapefruit juice together.

Name: Zambeer
Directions: Mix sambuca with rootbeer and stir. Add ice

Name: Zorbatini
Directions: Prepare like a Martini. Garnish with a green olive.

Name: Zenmeister
Directions: Mix together and enjoy

Name: Zipperhead
Directions: Fill glass with rocks, add straw before putting in liquor. Then add the ingredients in order, trying to keep layered as much as possible (i.e. Chambord on bottom, then Vodka, Then soda on top).

Name: Zima Blaster
Directions: Fill glass with ice. Pour in Chambord, then fill with Zima. Mix and enjoy.

Name: Zizi Coin-coin
Directions: Pour 5cl of Cointreau on ice, add 2cl of fresh lemon (or lime) juice, stir gently, and finally add slices of lemon/lime in glass.

Name: Zippy's Revenge
Directions: Mix Kool-Aid to taste then add Rum and ammaretto. shake well to disolve the sugar in the Kool-Aid... serve cold

Name: Zimadori Zinger
Directions: Pour Zima in a collins glass over ice and then pour the shot of Midori. Don't stir. Garnish with a cherry.

Name: Ziemes Martini Apfelsaft
Directions: Serve without ice. At least the juice shold have room temperature.
